Changes in grsecurity-2.2.2-2.6.39.1-201106042120.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
prevent getattr on /proc/pid entries hidden from readdir by proc restrictions 
(already prevented under RBAC)
thanks to Arach of #grsecurity for reporting

 1 file changed, 7 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.2-2.6.39.1-201106032238.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
update to the latest PaX patch, fixes compilation on old gcc (-Wno-empty-body)
introduces gcc plugin as part of PAX_MEMORY_STACKLEAK
leaves explicit pax_track_stack calls for the gcc < 4.5 case, uses 
plugin-instrumented calls on gcc >= 4.5

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.2-2.6.38.6-201105171730.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
update to latest PaX patch with new STACKLEAK support with functions with large 
stack frames automatically instrumented for improved speed/security
enforce user bans from suid bruteforce/kernel lockout at setuid(uid) time in 
addition to exec time, from Dan Rosenberg, but with a rewritten fix that actually 
does something in the !RBAC case, and doesn't introduce a trivially triggered 
local backdoor via refcount overflow in the RBAC case

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.2-2.6.38.4-201105102149.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
improve STACKLEAK by adjusting magic detection algorithm, performance remains 
roughly the same.  Introduce forced stack probing in functions with high 
uninitialized stack usage

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.1-2.6.37-201102121148.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
security fix backports from mainline
MODHARDEN won't log about userland trying to use an ipv6 socket if there's no
kernel support for one
no longer logging handled signals or counting them toward crash limits
added more signals to bruteforcing detection
added compat mode for PAX_MPROTECT to revert to the old RWX -> RW demotion
behavior

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.1-2.6.36.2-201101010125.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
Two security fixes and two non-security fixes from Greg Beeley:
1) grsec ignored clock_settime in its time change logging and ignored the 
compat versions of time changing functions on 64bit kernels
2) grsec failed to enforce ptrace restrictions or perform auditing for the 
compat version of ptrace on 64bit kernels
3) add cap_valid() to capable_nolog()
4) standardize time change logging to always log prior to the system time being 
modified
5) found by me after further auditing: we missed the readdir/getdents/getdents 
compat syscalls in RBAC enforcement of hidden files
I've updated my build/test system to perform regression tests against the 
compat userland case so these problems don't occur again.

 fs/compat.c               |   18 ++++++++++++++++++
 kernel/capability.c       |    5 +++++
 kernel/posix-timers.c     |    3 +++
 kernel/ptrace.c           |    9 ++++++++-
 kernel/time.c             |    8 ++++----
 kernel/time/timekeeping.c |    3 +++
 6 files changed, 41 insertions(+), 5 deletions(-)
---------------------------------------------------------------

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.1-2.6.36.2-201012191316.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
Update to latest PaX release, includes x86 UDEREF rewrite that changes 
user/kernel accessors to accessing through the gs segment register.  This makes 
UDEREF incompatible with SSP, but closes the KERNEL_DS hole in a generic way, 
simplifies the UDEREF code, and makes KERNEL_DS only allow copies within the 
kernel (vanilla permits within the entire address space)
changes ACCESS_ONCE back to using const
fixed info-leak in hpsa scsi driver
harmless gcc warning fix in gracl.c

 arch/x86/Kconfig                        |    3 
 arch/x86/include/asm/futex.h            |   74 --
 arch/x86/include/asm/stackprotector.h   |    2 
 arch/x86/include/asm/uaccess.h          |   57 -

Changes in grsecurity-2.2.1-2.6.36.2-201012182005.patch:
---------------------------------------------------------------
Fix RBAC regression on creating files that match globbed objects, introduced
in 201012121726 patch, reported by zakalwe.  Added a test for this case to the
regression suite.
Info-leak reported by Dan Rosenberg in cciss driver fixed
